column2: FARM DAYS at Pike Place Market
column5:
Shop from Pike Place Market farmers on the cobblestones of Pike Place every Wednesday, Saturday and Sunday this summer.

Choose from the season's best berries, greens, herbs, vegetables and much more.

On Sundays, the north end of Pike Place is closed to traffic, creating more room to shop and walk. Join us each Sunday for a cooking demo or two and learn from local chefs. Demos begin at noon and 2:00 p.m. each Sunday (note: chef demos are subject to change or cancellation without notice).

Chef demo schedule and weekly chef bios

Join us at our weekly remote markets again this summer! Shop from Pike Place Market farmers at a location convenient to your office.

Pike Place Market Express at City Hall Plaza
begins June 22, then every Tuesday through September
10 am - 2 pm

Pike Place Market Express in the Cascade Neighborhood
begins June 24, then every Thursday through September
3 - 7 pm
New location: On Minor Ave. between Thomas & Harrison Streets, one block east of Fairview Ave. N.

Put on something stylish and come to the 3rd level downunder at Pike Place Market for the official Launch of Flair Studio & Boutique from 5-9 pm.

Live Painting by the artist and the artists at THE STUDIO across the way. Â Live music from 5-7 pm.Â 

Proceeds will be donated to the Market Foundation.

Event info: www.facebook.com/events/508733225839072/

Festa di San Valentino

Valentine's Day is a day to express your love and to celebrate the spirit of love. For over 35 years Il Bistro, tucked away underneath the Pike Place Market, has offered Seattle romantic and fine dining with classic Italian fare. The romantic and warm atmosphere that started in 1975 still resonates within these walls today.

Il Bistro is one of the most romantic places to be on Feb. 14th with a complimentary red rose for each couple, and to make the atmosphere even more romantic, the Mike Stafford Jazz Trio will be performing live throughout the evening.

Enjoy a truly special and romantic dinner with that special someone. You will love the San Valentino-inspired delicious Prezzo Fisso, "Prix-Fixe," Chef Nathan Louma is preparing. Featuring four courses of indulgence from Kumamoto Oysters Served For Two to Maine Lobster & Cappellini Pasta in a Saffron-Prosecco Cream.

Can't make it on the 14th? Look forÂ tasty courses fromÂ their Valentineâ€™s Day menu available a la carte beginning Friday, February 11 through Sunday, February 13 for dinner.

Call or visitÂ their web site to make reservations as space is very limited on this busy weekend.

Meet the Producer during our free farmtable tours taking place each Saturday and Sunday starting September 25. Meet the farmers and then shop for the best in farm fresh produce!

Tours will be held each Saturday and Sunday atÂ 1:00 p.m.Â and meet at the Farm InfoÂ TentÂ near the north end of Pike Place.Â Tours will last 20-30 minutes and will feature a brief introduction of each farmer by the Market Master on duty that day, who will lead the tour. (The Market Master is in charge of farm and crafts set-up each day.) Farmers will talk about themselves, their farm, what they grow, and how they grow it.Â Some farmers will offer sample of their products. Tours will include farmers selling fresh fruits and vegetables on the street, those selling value added products on the dry side, and possibly a few flower farmers if time allows.Â Â 

Please join us for one or more tours this summer and get to know the farmers you shop from each week. Stop by the Farm InfoÂ Tent at 1:00 any Saturday or Sunday.

Â

Each Sunday this summer, stop by our Market tent on the north end of Pike Place and learn from a local chef as they demonstrate a recipe using locally grown produce. Noon and 2:00 p.m. most days (note: subject to change or cancellation without notice).

Featured Chefs this Sunday

Upcoming Chefs

SeptemberÂ 29 at noon.:Â Phyllis Rosen of Catering by Phyllis

SeptemberÂ 29 at 2:00 p.m.:Â Jeremy McLachlan of Salty's on AlkiÂ 

Jeremy McLachlan started his culinary career at Saltyâ€™s on the Columbia in Portland at the age of 18. After four years, he transferred to the Redondo Beach Saltyâ€™s and then became Alki Sous Chef. His was promoted to Executive Chef at Saltyâ€™s on the Columbia, where he received rave reviews from local media food writers for his attention to detail. He decided to head back to Seattle to work at the best seafood restaurant in Seattle. He made his impact in the community and culinary world for the past six years with a live radio show and countless charitable events.Â  â€œMy love is to create great dishes with fresh seafood, as we are a seafood restaurant, but not forget the meat lovers. We are in the backyard of the greatest seafood on the planet,â€ says Chef McLachlan. He has now moved on as Saltyâ€™s Corporate Executive Chef.



2012 Summer Sunday Chef Demo Schedule

September 30 at noon: Phyllis Rosen of Catering by Phyllis
September 30 at 2:00 p.m.: Jeremy McLachlan of Salty's on AlkiÂ 


Subject to change or cancellation without notice.

column2: Magic in the Market Holiday Kick-off
column5:
Join us for our annual holiday kick-off, filled with an afternoon of festive music and a visit from Santa. Holiday lights adorning the Market's buildings and trees will be turned on at 5:00 p.m. Celebrate the start of the holiday season!

Holiday Photos with Santa
Santa will appear under the Market clockÂ in front ofÂ the Market's vintage farmtruck. Take your own holiday photoÂ at this picturesque Seattle spot! 1:00 - 5:00 p.m.

Gift Wrapping
Shop from local artists and craftspeople in the North Arcade--or from any of our hundreds of unique specialty shops, then have your gifts wrapped by the Market Foundation for a suggested $5 donation. They'll be located on Pike Place near the North Arcade entranceÂ underÂ a white tent from 1:00 - 5:00 p.m.

Festive Music
Along with the sounds ofÂ ourÂ own Market buskers, enjoy the Dickens CarollersÂ as they stroll the Market in their Victorian attireÂ in the mid-afternoon. Starting at 4:30, they'll appear under the Market clock.

Holiday Lights
Join us under the clock at 5:00 p.m. for our annualÂ holiday lighting.Â Lights along our buildings and on our large tree will be turned on for the season. It's the most beautiful time of the year in the Market!

column2: Spaces for Urban Living: Downtown Home Tour
column5:
Experience what life would be like to live downtown at the Market Foundation's Spaces for Urban Living: Downtown Home Tour.

Homes in the self-guided walking tour are selected because of interest in the building's or particular unit's architecture or interior design, art, use of space and the ways the home reflect the personalities of the residents. From funky to chic, all the homes are distinctive.

The 2010 tour features homes in buildings located within walking distance of the Pike Place Market, including Fifteen Twenty-One Second Avenue, The Watermark, The Grand Pacific and the Market's Livingston Baker Building.

Purchase tickets online by Friday, June 25th (by 1pm) to receive the Early Bird discount. Cost of advance tickets: $25.

You can also register the day of the tour beginning at noon at the Home Tour registration tent near Rachel the Pig at the main Market entrance on Pike Street or at BoConcept, located at 901 Western Ave. Day of event ticket cost: $30.

During the Tour, stop by BoConcept (901 Western Ave.) for refreshments and to meet their skilled design consultants who will introduce you to the latest in affordable luxury design and help you decorate the home of your dreams!

The 2010 Spaces for Urban Living: Downtown Home Tour is sponsored by BoConcept.

Event proceeds benefit the Market's human service agencies: Pike Market Medical Clinic, Child Care & Preschool, Senior Center and the Downtown Food Bank.

Beginning November 26th, the annual Market Foundation Giving Tree will be decorated with holiday wishes from low-income members of the Market community. The Giving Tree benefits low-income Market residents and members, clients and students of the Pike Market Senior Center, Medical Clinic, Food Bank, Childcare and Preschool and Heritage House at the Market. The tree will be located in the DownUnderbetween Hands of the World and The Magic Shop.Â Stop by and share the spirit of the holiday season by selecting a wish or two.

LearnÂ about the Market Foundation

column2: Celebrate Your Valentines at Pike Place Market
column5:
Shop from Market farmers and craftspeople for flowers and unique gifts, plus make valentines at the crafts tent.Â Â 
Â Â 
Itâ€™s the season of love, and what better place to celebrate than the place everyone loves, Seattleâ€™s iconic Pike Place Market. There are hundreds of gift ideas for those you love. Local farmers offer fresh, greenhouse-grown tulips.Â Pick up colorful bouquets from Alm Hill Gardens and Jonkheer Greenhouses. Marshland Orchards has plants for those with a green-thumb.

Plus, find handmade, unique crafts from over 200 craftspeople. From fine paintings, jewelry and sculpture,Â  to glass art, fabric arts, photography, pottery, bath and body products,Â and much more.

Bring the family to the Market February 12 through 14 and create your own handmade valentines to give away. Look for the Cupid Tent set up on the Pike Place cobblestones from 10 a.m. to 3 p.m.

Taste, celebrate, and learn about artisanal cheese as the Pike Place Market will once again host the Seattle Cheese Festival. Look for more than 250 cheeses from local and international producers. Enjoy samples and cooking demonstrations and relax in the wine garden. More information on their website.

A benefit for the Pike Place Market Foundation
August 17th, 2012, 7:30pm - 11:00pm
Â 
Join us for the 17th annual Sunset Supper at the Market. For one evening, Pike Place Market will be transformed into a delightful party venue, where you will sample and sip your way through the booths of fine restaurants, wineries, breweries, and spirits purveyors. Chat with chefs, mingle with your friends, and dance under the stars to live music. More infoÂ

It's the Market's 105th birthday! Join us on this special day to enjoy your Market favorites--whether it's coffee and pastry, shopping the craftsline, filling up on farm fresh produce, or enjoying a great lunch or dinner. Please check back for other birthday festivities.

Discover unique crafts from more than 200 local artists and "Meet the Producer." Join the Daystall Artists of Pike Place Market as they celebrate American Craft Week, October 1-10.Â Artists selling their unique locally made handicrafts and artwork: a tradition at the Market since the mid-1900â€™s.Â Shop early for the holidays!

Pike Place Market is a unique destination for the holidays. Shoppers will find a diverse array of one-of-a-kind gifts and crafts, specialty food items for the table and eclectic dining at Market restaurants, cafes and bars.
Magic in the Market on November 24
Meet Santa under the Marketâ€™s iconic clock and Public Market sign and sing along with the award-winning Dickenson Carolers. Great Figgy Pudding Street Corner Caroling Competition teams will entertain the crowd with comic and singular renditions of holiday carols. Expect the unexpected!
At 5 pm, Santa leads a countdown to the lighting of the Marketâ€™s 20-foot Holiday Tree, strawberry and carrot. The Dickenson Carolers will lead the crowd in carols as the dusk deepens. Stay warm with hot cider and enjoy the holiday cheer at the Market!
Pike Place Market is a unique destination for the holidays. Shoppers will find a diverse array of one-of-a-kind gifts and crafts, specialty food items for the table and eclectic dining at Market restaurants, cafes and bars.Â

At 5 pm, Santa leads a countdown to the lighting of the Marketâ€™s 20-foot Holiday Tree, strawberry and carrot. The Dickens Carolers will lead the crowd in carols as the dusk deepens. Stay warm with hot cider and enjoy the holiday cheer at the Market!

column2: 24th Annual Great Figgy Pudding Street Corner Caroling Competition
column5:
It's Seattle's most heart-warming holiday tradition, attracting nearly 10,000 people every year. Immerse yourself in the holiday spirit as 40-plus caroling teams sing their hearts out on downtown Seattle street corners in and around Westlake Center. The top teams then compete in a sing-off on the Figgy Main Stage. More details about the event.

Register your Figgy Caroling Team today! Teams can sign up through Monday, November 30.

All donations benefit the Pike Market Senior Center and Downtown Food Bank, providing year-round emergency food, employment, social services, and compassionate care to low-income adn homeless seniors and individuals in downtown Seattle.

It's beginning to look a lot like the holidays at the Pike Place Market, with Santa's helpers busy decking the halls with lights and greenery to adorn Market buildings.

The grand centerpiece of the Market's holiday decorations isÂ a 20-foot tall Noble Fir treeÂ from Poulsbo. It arrives in the Market via our renovated 1936 vintage farmtruck. It will be placed in proper position, just waiting for the Market's tree lighting ceremony on Saturday, November 27 at 5:00 p.m.

An Annual Springtime Tradition

For the 16th year, Pike Place Market sponsors Daffodil Day, an annual event celebrating spring's arrival. On March 20, Pike Place Market community members, including students from the Pike Market ChildCare and Preschool, will hand out 10,000 locally grown daffodils to downtown shoppers, workers and residents.Â 

Date: March 20

Time: 11:30 am - 1:30 pmÂ

column2: Shop for bouquets at the 4th annual Pike Place Market Flower Fest
column5:
Celebrate Mother's Day Weekend with a trip to the Market to buy flowers for your favorite moms. Farmers inside the Arcade and under about 40 tents on the streets will create andÂ offer beautiful bouquets perfect to brighten any mom's weekend.Â On the craftstables,Â lookÂ for many floral-themed handcrafted gifts--from glass art to yard art--made by Market craftspeople. You can also create your own card for mom atÂ a free card making tent on the street.

Look for tents on the cobblestones of Pike Place from Pine Street to Virginia, from 10:00 a.m. - 6:00 p.m.

Show $35 in receipts from Pike Place Market vendors at the Market Info Booth and get a pass for that dayâ€™s parking at the Public Market Parking Garage at 1531Western Avenue

Santa arrives early this year with a great deal for shoppers at the Pike Place Market. From *10 a.m. to 5 p.m. each Saturday now through New Yearâ€™s Day (except Christmas DayÂ when the Market is closed), shoppers can park for free in the Public Market Parking Garage at 1531 Western AvenueÂ if they buy at least $35 worth of merchandise from Pike Place Market merchants.

Hereâ€™s how it works: On those Saturdays, park at the Public Market Parking Garage at 1531 Western Avenue at orÂ after 10 a.m.Â (see map on this page). Look for the entrance next to the tattoo shop. There is also an entrance off Alaskan Way across from the Seattle Aquarium. Purchase a minimum of $35 in merchandise from any Pike Place Market merchants, farmers, or craftspeople, and ask for receipts. (See directory of merchants here.) Bring your receipts and garage entrance ticket to the Information Booth at First & Pike for validation and a pass for the garage. The pass is good for 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. that Saturday only, one per customer. (*Note: garage entry tickets must be pulled at or afterÂ 10 a.m. Tickets pulled earlier will not be eligible for this promotion. Customers parking before 10 am or after 5 pm must pay the duration of their stay.)

5th Annual Pike Place Market Flower Festival

Motherâ€™s Day weekend is a special weekend at Pike Place Market. The flower stalls overflow into the street with nearly 40 tents set up on the cobblestone street of Pike Place featuring three dozen flower farmers from King, Snohomish, and Whatcom Counties.

Watch the local farmers createÂ gorgeous spring bouquets. Pick up a bouquet or two and make a Momâ€™s Day card in our card making booth.

Join us at 2 pm for a talk by gardening maven Ciscoe Morris who will give gardening tips and advice followed by a Q and A.

column2: Celebrate Macaron Day at Le Panier
column5:
Jour du Macarons is a celebration of these tasty treats with a focus on giving back. You can help out, one macaron at a time, at LePanier. From March 16-20, 10% of all macarons sales will benefit Seattle Tilth. Le Panier is at the corner of Pike Place and Stewart Streets, and opens daily at 7:00 a.m.

Pike Place Market celebrates American Craft Week, October 5-14 and recognizes the thousands of American artists who produce handmade decorative and functional artisan crafts that fuel our creative economy, brighten our living and work spaces and connect us to our past.

The Market is proud to be the home of an internationally-recognized crafts market that represents the work of more than 200 talented craftspeople. Join the celebration! Learn more about American Craft Week.

column2: Shop Hands of the World, Get $5 Parking Voucher for Public Market Parking Garage
column5:
Spend $50 or more at Hands of the World, and get a free gift: a $5 voucher for parking at the Public Market Parking Garage (located at 1531 Western Avenue, right behind the Market). Time to shop for your Valentine--or yourself!

Shop February 1 - 15, 10:00 a.m. - 5:30 p.m. More details here

column2: Beaujolais Concert and Dinner at Maximilien Restaurant
column5:
In celebration of the new Beaujolais of 2011, Maximilien Restaurant is holding a wine concert and a three-course dinner. Join them for one or both!

The concert, from 6 - 9 p.m., features Rouge. Cost is just $5 or $19 with a Beaujolais Wine Sampler included. The concert is free for those guests enjoying dinner. It will be held on Maximilien's heated patio with Puget Sound as a backdrop.

The three-course dinner is $39; seating is at 5:30 and 8:30 p.m. Choose your favorite of two appetizers and two entrees (one option is Seared Seabass with a red wine and demi glace reduction), then enjoy a pear and almond tart.

More information and reservations

A Celebration of Artisan Food, Craft Beer and Wine

Discover Seattle's newest local and independent purveyors of sweet and savory artisan foods. Visit with favorite vendors while tasting a wide variety of delicious, fresh, handcrafted foods, brews and wine with your friends.

Entrance fee includes keepsake glass and 10 tokens. Additional tokens can be purchased at the event. This event benefits the Market Foundation.

The Pike Place Market Foundation sponsors an annual holiday giving tree which is decorated with wishes from low-income adults and seniors who reside in the Market's subsidized apartment homes, from low-income families with a child attending the Preschool, low-income members of the Senior Center and clients of the Medical Clinic and Downtown Food Bank.

Beginning Friday, November 25th you and your family, friends and/or co-workers can help brighten the New Year for our low-income neighbors in the Market community by visiting the tree ~ located on the 4th Floor of the DownUnder Market (near the Giant Shoe Museum) ~ and selecting one or two of the modest wishes.

Can't make it to the Market? No worries--visit the virtual tree at starting Friday, November 25.

More information about the Market Foundation

While shopping at Pike Place Market this holiday season stop by and fulfill a wish or two from our Giving Trees. The Giving Trees will be decorated with lights and holiday wishes from low-income of the Pike Place Market community. Visit the trees located in the Marketâ€™s DownUnder (near Hands of the World) or the Market Atrium in the Economy Building.

If you miss the Giving Trees while in the Market, give online via ourÂ virtual tree.

Kent LovelaceÂ and Occitania through Monday, April 29

A longtime Seattle artist who is now based on Whidbey Island, Lovelace has painted on copper exclusively now for the past decade and a half.Â  He finds inspiration in landscapes that have been under cultivation for thousands of years. Occitania is an area in Southern France corresponding to areas once occupied by the Romans.

Artist Talk: Sunday, April 21 at 1 p.m. Hear Lovelace discuss his technique and motivation for working on copper.

Relay Dance Benefit:Â  Friday, April 19 from 6-10 p.m. Lisa Harris Gallery and Kent Lovelace welcome Relay Dance Collective for an evening of music, refreshments and more! For a $10 ticket, be treated to delectable hor d'oeuvres, dessert, beer or wine, and live music. Meet artist Kent Lovelace whose oil paintings on copper feature the French landscape.

Join us to make a positive difference in the lives of low-income children, families and seniors in our downtown community. The Care for the Market Luncheon raises funds and awareness for the Market Foundationâ€™s mission of preserving the traditions and diversity of the neighborhood that has often been called â€œthe soul of Seattleâ€. Our annual luncheon helps ensure that the Market Foundation will continue to be there to support the vital human services located in the Pike Place Market and utilized by over 10,000 each year: the Pike Market Medical Clinic, Preschool, Senior Center and Food Bank.
There is a $150 suggested minimum donation at the event. Our corporate sponsors generously cover all event expenses, allowing funds donated at the luncheon to go directly to support the vital services of the Marketâ€™s clinic, senior center, preschool and food bank.
